verses.roman:
upagīyamāno gandharvair
vanitā-śobhi-maṇḍale
reme kareṇu-yūtheśo
māhendra iva vāraṇaḥ

synonyms: upagīyamānaḥ—being praised in song; gandharvaiḥ—by Gandharvas; vanitā—by young women; śobhi—beautified; maṇḍale—in the circle; reme—He enjoyed; kareṇu—of she-elephants; yūtha—of a herd; īśaḥ—the master; māhā-indraḥ—of Lord Indra; iva—just like; vāraṇaḥ—the elephant (named Airāvata).
translation: As the Gandharvas sang His glories, Lord Balarāma enjoyed within the brilliant circle of young women. He appeared just like Indra's elephant, the lordly Airāvata, enjoying in the company of she-elephants.
